quotes.quote: If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.
quotes.speaker: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: I am fond of pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
quotes.speaker: Winston S. Churchill

quotes.quote: I shot an arrow into the air. It fell to earth, I knew not where.
quotes.speaker: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: May the forces of evil become confused while your arrow is on its way to the target.
quotes.speaker: George Carlin

quotes.quote: I don’t believe in astrology; I’m a Sagittarius and we’re skeptical.
quotes.speaker: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: A physician without a knowledge of astrology has no right to call himself a physician.
quotes.speaker: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: Bronze is the mirror of the form, wine of the mind.
quotes.speaker: Aeschylus

quotes.quote: I’m also interested in creating a lasting legacy... because bronze will last for thousands of years.
quotes.speaker: Richard MacDonald

quotes.quote: Thousands have lived without love, not one without water.
quotes.speaker: W. H. Auden

quotes.quote: The man who has grit enough to bring about the afforestation or the irrigation of a country is not less worthy of honor than its conqueror.
quotes.speaker: Sir John Thomson

quotes.quote: Each of us is carving a stone, erecting a column, or cutting a piece of stained glass in the construction of something much bigger than ourselves.
quotes.speaker: Adrienne Clarkson

quotes.quote: When wasteful war shall statues overturn, and broils root out the work of masonry.
quotes.speaker: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Who deserves more credit than the wife of a coal miner?
quotes.speaker: Merle Travis

quotes.quote: When you find yourself in a hole, quit digging.
quotes.speaker: Will Rogers

quotes.quote: No man ever wetted clay and then left it, as if there would be bricks by chance and fortune.
quotes.speaker: Plutarch

quotes.quote: I thought clay must feel happy in the good potter’s hand.
quotes.speaker: Janet Fitch

quotes.quote: Vessels large may venture more, but little boats should keep near shore.
quotes.speaker: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: It is not that life ashore is distasteful to me. But life at sea is better.
quotes.speaker: Sir Francis Drake

quotes.quote: Sometimes the wheel turns slowly, but it turns.
quotes.speaker: Lorne Michaels

quotes.quote: Don’t reinvent the wheel, just realign it.
quotes.speaker: Anthony D’Angelo

quotes.quote: Writing means sharing. It’s part of the human condition to want to share things – thoughts, ideas, opinions.
quotes.speaker: Paulo Coelho

quotes.quote: Writing is easy. All you have to do is cross out the wrong words.
quotes.speaker: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: And all I ask is a tall ship and a star to steer her by.
quotes.speaker: John Masefield

quotes.quote: Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
quotes.speaker: Omar Bradley

quotes.quote: Create with the heart; build with the mind.
quotes.speaker: Criss Jami

quotes.quote: The four building blocks of the universe are fire, water, gravel and vinyl.
quotes.speaker: Dave Barry

quotes.quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
quotes.speaker: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Money, if it does not bring you happiness, will at least help you be miserable in comfort.
quotes.speaker: Helen Gurley Brown

quotes.quote: “One man’s ‘magic’ is another man’s engineering.
quotes.speaker: Robert Heinlein

quotes.quote: Normal people... believe that if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it. Engineers believe that if it ain’t broke, it doesn’t have enough features yet.
quotes.speaker: Scott Adams

quotes.quote: No hour of life is wasted that is spent in the saddle.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: A man on a horse is spiritually as well as physically bigger than a man on foot.
quotes.speaker: John Steinbeck

quotes.quote: The Lord made us all out of iron. Then he turns up the heat to forge some of us into steel.
quotes.speaker: Marie Osmond

quotes.quote: Everything has its limit – iron ore cannot be educated into gold.
quotes.speaker: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Without mathematics, there’s nothing you can do. Everything around you is mathematics. Everything around you is numbers.
quotes.speaker: Shakuntala Devi

quotes.quote: If I were again beginning my studies, I would follow the advice of Plato and start with mathematics.
quotes.speaker: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: I cannot imagine any condition which would cause a ship to founder... Modern shipbuilding has gone beyond that.
quotes.speaker: Capt. E.J. Smith, RMS Titanic

quotes.quote: There is nothing but a plank between a sailor and eternity.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Gibbons

quotes.quote: We are all apprentices in a craft where no one ever becomes a master.
quotes.speaker: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: There is no easy way to train an apprentice. My two tools are example and nagging.
quotes.speaker: Lemony Snicket

quotes.quote: An architect should live as little in cities as a painter. Send him to our hills, and let him study there what nature understands by a buttress, and what by a dome.
quotes.speaker: John Ruskin

quotes.quote: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out.
quotes.speaker: Revelation 3:12

quotes.quote: Rocks in my path? I keep them all. With them I shall build my castle.
quotes.speaker: Nemo Nox

quotes.quote: If you see a castle under fog, you must walk there to meet the extraordinary dreams.
quotes.speaker: Mehmet Murat Ildan

quotes.quote: The purpose of education is to replace an empty mind with an open one.
quotes.speaker: Malcolm Forbes

quotes.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
quotes.speaker: Aristotle

quotes.quote: I’d imagine the whole world as one big machine. Machines never come with any spare parts, you know. They always come with the exact amount they need.
quotes.speaker: Hugo Cabret

quotes.quote: Remember that people break down, too, not just machinery.
quotes.speaker: Gregory Benford

quotes.quote: Blast – Build – Battle
quotes.speaker: Motto of the U.S. 16th Engineer Brigade

quotes.quote: The more science intervenes in warfare, the more will be the need for engineers in the field armies; in the late war there were never enough sappers at any time.
quotes.speaker: Bernard Montgomery

quotes.quote: Tactics mean doing what you can with what you have.
quotes.speaker: Saul Alinsky

quotes.quote: Strategy requires thought; tactics require observation.
quotes.speaker: Max Euwe

quotes.quote: Few inventions have been so simple as the stirrup, but few have had so catalytic an influence on history.
quotes.speaker: Lynn White Jr.

quotes.quote: Betwixt the stirrup and the ground, Mercy I asked, mercy I found.
quotes.speaker: William Camden

quotes.quote: Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another.
quotes.speaker: Plato

quotes.quote: Astronomy’s much more fun when you’re not an astronomer.
quotes.speaker: Brian May

quotes.quote: If you owe the bank $100 that’s your problem. If you owe the bank $100 million, that’s the bank’s problem.
quotes.speaker: J. Paul Getty

quotes.quote: I saw a bank that said ’24-Hour Banking,’ but I didn’t have that much time.
quotes.speaker: Steven Wright

quotes.quote: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a cartographer.
quotes.speaker: John Quincy Adams

quotes.quote: Not all who wander are lost.
quotes.speaker: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: The real use of gunpowder is to make all men tall.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: Man is a military animal, glories in gunpowder, and loves parades.
quotes.speaker: Philip Bailey

quotes.quote: People can have the Model T in any color – so long as it’s black.
quotes.speaker: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: What can be labeled, packaged, mass produced is neither truth nor art.
quotes.speaker: Marty Rubin

quotes.quote: And first Hephaestus makes a great and massive shield... And he forged on the shield two noble cities.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote: Don’t judge someone until you’ve stood at his forge and worked with his hammer.
quotes.speaker: Rick Riordan

quotes.quote: The pen might not be mightier than the sword, but maybe the printing press is heavier than the siege weapon. Just a few words can change everything.
quotes.speaker: Terry Pratchett

quotes.quote: What gunpowder did for war the printing press has done for the mind.
quotes.speaker: Wendell Phillips

quotes.quote: The lowest is to attack a city. Siege of a city is only done as a last resort.
quotes.speaker: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: All the best romances bloom in the midst of a good siege.
quotes.speaker: Miles Cameron

quotes.quote: There is little man has made that approaches anything in nature, but a sailing ship does.
quotes.speaker: Allan Villiers

quotes.quote: It’s not the towering sails, but the unseen wind that moves a ship.
quotes.speaker: English Proverb

quotes.quote: It’s one thing to surmise what happened, but we don’t speculate on that until ballistics confirms what happened...
quotes.speaker: John Hansen

quotes.quote: Let’s get on our knees and pray. I don’t know to whom. Is there a patron saint of ballistics yet?
quotes.speaker: Adam Savage

quotes.quote: Economics is a subject that does not greatly respect one’s wishes.
quotes.speaker: Nikita Khrushchev

quotes.quote: You and I come by road or rail, but economists travel on infrastructure.
quotes.speaker: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.quote: I think the human race made a big mistake at the beginning of the Industrial Revolution, we leaped for the mechanical things. People need the use of their hands to feel creative.
quotes.speaker: Andre Norton

quotes.quote: The key words of violent economics are urbanization, industrialization, centralization, efficiency, quantity, speed.
quotes.speaker: E.F. Schumacher

quotes.quote: However beautiful the strategy, you should occasionally look at the results.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: No one starts a war – or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so – without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it.
quotes.speaker: Karl von Clausewitz

quotes.quote: Bolt actions speak louder than words.
quotes.speaker: Craig Roberts

quotes.quote: Never criticize a rifleman until you have walked a mile in his shoes. That way, he’ll be barefoot and you’ll be out of range.
quotes.speaker: The 2nd Target Company

quotes.quote: No innovation in the past 200 years has done more to save lives and improve health than the sanitation revolution triggered by the invention of the toilet.
quotes.speaker: Sylvia Burwell

quotes.quote: Apart from the sanitation, the medicine, education, wine, public order, roads, the fresh water system, and public health... what have the Romans ever done for us?
quotes.speaker: John Cleese

quotes.quote: Claims that cannot be tested, assertions immune to disproof are veridically worthless, whatever value they may have in inspiring us or exciting our sense of wonder.
quotes.speaker: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: If facts don’t fit the theory, change the facts.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: It is arguable whether the human race have been gainers by the march of science beyond the steam engine.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Science owes more to the steam engine than the steam engine owes to science.
quotes.speaker: Lawrence Henderson

quotes.quote: Chemistry is the dirty part of physics.
quotes.speaker: Peter Reiss

quotes.quote: Chemists do not usually stutter. It would be very awkward if they did, seeing that they have at times to get out such words as methylethylamylophenylium.
quotes.speaker: Sir William Crookes

quotes.quote: The cars haven’t advanced that much since we were kids. When you boil it down, it’s still a gas combustion engine.
quotes.speaker: Dana Brunetti

quotes.quote: I have always considered that the substitution of the internal combustion engine for the horse marked a very gloomy milestone in the progress of mankind.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: If it weren’t for electricity, we’d all be watching television by candlelight.
quotes.speaker: George Gobel

quotes.quote: Benjamin Franklin may have discovered electricity, but it was the man who invented the meter who made the money.
quotes.speaker: Earl Wilson

quotes.quote: For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.
quotes.speaker: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: If you can walk away from a landing, it’s a good landing. If you use the airplane the next day, it’s an outstanding landing.
quotes.speaker: Chuck Yeager

quotes.quote: A world without radio is a deaf world.
quotes.speaker: Ernest Yeboah

quotes.quote: Radio is the theater of the mind; television is the theater of the mindless.
quotes.speaker: Steve Allen

quotes.quote: Engineering is the art of directing the great sources of power in nature for the use and convenience of man.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Tredgold

quotes.quote: For a machine to run smoothly and predictably, its parts must be standard and hence replaceable.
quotes.speaker: Charles Eisenstein

quotes.quote: Many of us take better care of our automobiles than we do of our own bodies... yet the auto has replaceable parts.
quotes.speaker: B.J. Palmer

quotes.quote: The best steel doesn’t always shine the brightest.
quotes.speaker: Joe Abercrombie

quotes.quote: There are three things extremely hard: steel, a diamond, and to know one’s self.
quotes.speaker: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Untutored courage is useless in the face of educated bullets.
quotes.speaker: George Patton

quotes.quote: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
quotes.speaker: W. Clement Stone

quotes.quote: Sure, jets are fast and economical, but, oh my, what fun we’ve lost and what leisure we’ve sacrificed in the race for efficiency.
quotes.speaker: Ginger Rogers

quotes.quote: If God had really intended men to fly, He’d make it easier to get to the airport.
quotes.speaker: George Winters

quotes.quote: Better to fight for something than live for nothing.
quotes.speaker: George S. Patton

quotes.quote: The chief incalculable in war is the human will.
quotes.speaker: B.H. Liddell Hart.

quotes.quote: To err is human, but to really foul things up you need a computer.
quotes.speaker: Paul R. Ehrlich

quotes.quote: The good thing about computers is that they do what you tell them to do. The bad news is that they do what you tell them to do.
quotes.speaker: Ted Nelson

quotes.quote: If you go on with this nuclear arms race, all you are going to do is make the rubble bounce.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Leave the atom alone.
quotes.speaker: E. Y. Harburg

quotes.quote: In the hierarchy of the major poetic substances, plastic figures as a disgraced material, lost between the effusiveness of rubber and the flat hardness of metal.
quotes.speaker: Roland Barthes

quotes.quote: Nothing on this earth lasts forever. Except maybe plastic.
quotes.speaker: Patricia Dunn

quotes.quote: Rocket science has been mythologized all out of proportion to its true difficulty.
quotes.speaker: John Carmack

quotes.quote: When you launch a rocket, you’re not really flying that rocket. You’re just sort of hanging on.
quotes.speaker: Michael P. Anderson

quotes.quote: There’s so much plastic in this culture that vinyl leopard skin is becoming an endangered synthetic.
quotes.speaker: Lily Tomlin

quotes.quote: There may be no forgiveness for polyester. On this one matter, Satan and the Lord are in agreement.
quotes.speaker: Joe Hill

quotes.quote: All material things seem to have been composed of the hard and solid particles... variously associated with the first Creation by the counsel of an Intelligent Agent.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote: It is obvious that while science is struggling to bring Heaven to Earth some men are using its materials in the construction of Hell.
quotes.speaker: Herbert Hoover

quotes.quote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you were heading.
quotes.speaker: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: I love watching my mom argue with the GPS on the way home.
quotes.speaker: Isabelle Fuhrman

quotes.quote: When God said, ‘Let there be light,’ he surely must have meant perfectly coherent light.
quotes.speaker: Charles Townes

quotes.quote: I’m a big laser believer – I really think they are the wave of the future.
quotes.speaker: Courteney Cox

quotes.quote: If technology is the engine of change, then nanotechnology is the fuel for humanity’s future.
quotes.speaker: Natasha Vita-More

quotes.quote: Many, many rules had begun to bend at the hand of nanotechnology... This produced a lot of good, and a lot of bad.
quotes.speaker: Matt Spire

quotes.quote: I am a big proponent of harnessing the power of fusion – from 93 million miles away. Fusion is done by our sun really, really well and for free. Here on Earth in reactors, not so much.
quotes.speaker: Joe Romm

quotes.quote: When we look up at night and view the stars, everything we see is shining because of distant nuclear fusion.
quotes.speaker: Carl Sagan

quotes.quote: Robotics has been around forever, and it’s been the next big thing forever, and it is so exciting and compelling that it’s easy to get carried away.
quotes.speaker: Colin Angle

quotes.quote: I’ll be back.
A satellite has no conscience.
quotes.speaker: Edward R. Murrow

quotes.quote: Right now there are thirty-one satellites zipping around the world with nothing better to do than help you find your way to the grocery store.
quotes.speaker: Ed Burnette

quotes.quote: I would say invisibility would be sort of a fun power to have just to see what it was like to move through the world and not be looked at.
quotes.speaker: Kevin Bacon

quotes.quote: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.
quotes.speaker: Patti Smith

quotes.quote: Mr. Watson... Come here... I want to see you.
quotes.speaker: Alexander Graham Bell

quotes.quote: The single biggest problem in communication is the illusion that it has taken place.
quotes.speaker: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: Will no entreaties cause thee to turn a favourable eye upon thy creature, who implores thy goodness and compassion?
quotes.speaker: Mary Shelley

quotes.quote: The incomplete becomes complete; the crooked becomes straight; the empty becomes full; the worn out becomes new.
quotes.speaker: Tao Te Ching, Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: If there is any work in the afterlife, you must do it. Behold me whenever you are called. Be watchful at any moment to work there. Plough my fields, carry water and sand to the east and west. Behold me whenever you are called.
quotes.speaker: Inscription on an Egyptian Ushabti

quotes.quote: There is nothing like a dream to create the future.
quotes.speaker: Victor Hugo

quotes.quote: Even though the future seems far away, it is actually beginning right now.
quotes.speaker: Mattie Stepanek

quotes.quote: No, my friends, we have not fallen back upon the earth; no, nor are we submerged in the Gulf of Mexico. Yes! we are mounting into space. See those stars shining in the night, and that impenetrable darkness heaped up between the earth and us!
quotes.speaker: Jules Verne

quotes.quote: After eleven Days Passage in this violent Flight, I perceived we began to approach another Earth (if I may so call it) being the Globe or very Body of that Star which we call the Moon.
quotes.speaker: Francis Godwin

quotes.quote: If the enemy know not where he will be attacked, he must prepare in every quarter, and so be everywhere weak.
quotes.speaker: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: I must go down to the seas again, to the vagrant gypsy life, To the gull’s way and the whale’s way where the wind’s like a whetted knife;
quotes.speaker: John Masefield

quotes.quote: Then you drive out where the storm-clouds swallow, And the sound of your oar-blades, falling hollow, As all we have left through the months to follow.
quotes.speaker: Rudyard Kipling

quotes.quote: It ascends from the earth to the heaven, and it again descends to the earth and receives the force of things superior and inferior.
quotes.speaker: Hermes Trismegistus
